name: HTML5
desc: A markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the World Wide Web.

name: CSS3
desc: A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML.

name: SASS
desc: A preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into Cascading Style Sheets.

name: Tailwind
desc: A utility-first CSS framework that can be composed directly in the HTML markup.

name: JavaScript
desc: A high-level, just-in-time compiled, multi-paradigm programming language.

name: TypeScript
desc: A strict syntactical superset of JavaScript which adds optional static typing to the language.

name: jQuery
desc: A JavaScript library designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling, CSS animation, and Ajax.

name: React
desc: A front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on UI components.

name: Gatsby
desc: A frontend JavaScript framework for creating SSR or static websites with React components.

name: Next.js
desc: A React framework built on top of Node.js which enables the creation of server-side and static websites.

name: Styled Components
desc: A library built for React which allows for component-level styles in applications (CSS-in-JS).

name: Node
desc: A back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

name: GraphQL
desc: A data query and manipulation language for APIs, and a runtime for fulfilling queries with existing data.

name: GraphCMS
desc: A free and open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database.

name: Redux
desc: A JavaScript library for managing and centralizing application state.

name: Python
desc: An interpreted high-level general-purpose programming language.

name: WordPress
desc: A free and open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database.

name: WooCommerce
desc: An e-commerce plugin designed for small to large-sized online merchants using WordPress.

name: PHP
desc: A general-purpose scripting language geared towards web development.

name: MySQL
desc: A relational database management system.

name: Figma
desc: A vector graphics editor and prototyping tool for web and mobile applications.

name: Photoshop
desc: A raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe Inc.

name: Adobe XD
desc: A vector-based user experience design tool for web apps and mobile apps.

name: Lightroom
desc: A creative image organization and image manipulation software.

name: Capture One
desc: A professional photo editing software, which offers image cataloguing, raw image file processing, and tethered photography.

name: Firebase
desc: A platform developed by Google for creating mobile and web applications.

name: Ubuntu
desc: A Linux distribution based on Debian and composed mostly of free and open-source software.

name: VSCode
desc: A source-code editor with support for debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, code refactoring, and embedded Git.

name: Spotify API
desc: Based on simple REST principles, the Spotify Web API endpoints return JSON metadata about music artists, albums, and tracks, directly from the Spotify Data Catalogue.

name: Netlify
desc: A San Francisco-based cloud computing company that offers hosting and serverless backend services for web applications and static websites.

name: Express
desc: A back end web application framework for Node.js designed for building web applications and APIs.

name: Google Cloud
desc: A suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure that Google uses internally for its end-user products.

name: React Router
desc: A standard library for routing in React. It enables the navigation among views of various components in a React Application.

name: Vercel
desc: A cloud platform provider intended to optimize the development and deployment experience for frontend teams.

name: Digital Ocean
desc: A cloud infrastructure provider for developers, startups, and SMBs with cloud infrastructure-as-a-service platforms.
